value.title: 20/20 computer vision for artificial intelligence
value.excerpt: From autonomous drones to driver-assist cars and shopping carts that can check you out of a supermarket without standing in line for a cashier, artificial intelligence is set to change our lives. But it doesn’t just happen.

value.title: Intel steers toward driverless future with Mobileye self-driving car unit
value.excerpt: Intel Corp's Mobileye is piloting a robotaxi service in Paris presently, and plans to take its self-driving car unit public in the US in mid-2022

value.title: Waymo says self-driving car that struck pedestrian in San Francisco was in manual mode
value.excerpt: A Waymo self-driving Jaguar I-Pace that struck a pedestrian in San Francisco on Wednesday evening was in manual mode, the company told TechCrunch in response to an initial report posted on Reddit. Waymo says the vehicle was in manual mode at the time,

value.title: TuSimple locks in self-driving trucks deal with DHL
value.excerpt: Self-driving trucks developer TuSimple has reached a deal to integrate its autonomous vehicle technology into DHL Supply Chain’s operations. As part of the deal, the contract logistics giant has reserved 100 autonomous trucks that are being co-developed by TuSimple and Navistar.

value.title: The many faces of artificial intelligence
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence has graduated from science fiction to being applied to almost everything. One dental hygiene manufacturer has even claimed its electric toothbrushes now incorporate the technology.

value.title: Famed Robot-Run ETF Says This Is Why It Now Has Tesla As Its Top Holding
value.excerpt: The Qraft AI-Enhanced U.S. Large Cap Momentum ETF (NYSE:AMOM), an exchange-traded fund driven by artificial intelligence that acquired a new stake in Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) earlier this month, has revealed why it now has the electric vehicle maker as its top holding.

value.title: Human Common-Sense, Animal Cognition, And AI Advances For Autonomous Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: Human common sense is difficult for AI developers to infuse into AI systems, including self-driving cars. We might learn something from animal common sense to help out on this vexing matter.

value.title: Why Are Tesla's Self Driving Software Sales Slowing Down?

value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence (AI) can provide technology that can streamline audiobook production and meet the constantly increasing demand.

value.title: California suspends Pony.ai driverless test permit after crash
value.excerpt: Pony.ai, a Chinese autonomous driving startup with an office in the U.S., has paused its driverless pilot fleet in California six months after it was approved by local regulators to test autonomous vehicles without a human safety driver.

value.title: A Need For Speed Is Driving CX Expectations
value.excerpt: Ensuring that the content surrounding a product is navigable and intuitive and that it offers quick solutions to users’ problems is one of the simplest and most critical methods for bringing B2B UX up to the standards of B2C counterparts.

value.title: California halts Pony.ai's driverless testing permit after accident
value.excerpt: A California regulator on Monday said it has suspended a driverless testing permit for startup technology firm Pony.ai following an accident.

value.title: The US-China Technology Arms Race. It’s Not A Two-Country Race Anymore.
value.excerpt: The global technology arms race is no longer a race among a few countries, especially the US and China. It's expanded, and includes a large number of countries all vying for competitive advantage. The US — one of the major players — must double down on its technology investment strategy — or lose.

value.title: Why Are Tesla’s Self Driving Software Sales Slowing Down?
value.excerpt: Firstly, Tesla has been increasingly emphasizing its Model 3 and Y vehicles, which have a lower starting price and this could be reducing attach rates for the self-driving package, which is likely a more popular option on higher-end cars.

value.title: Chinese AI Giant SenseTime Remains Committed To IPO Despite U.S. Blacklist
value.excerpt: Chinese artificial intelligence company SenseTime has decided to postpone its initial public offering in Hong Kong after it was put on a U.S. investment blacklist, although the company insists that it still intends to complete the listing.

value.title: New Artificial Intelligence System Enables Machines That See the World More Like Humans Do
value.excerpt: A new “common-sense” approach to computer vision enables artificial intelligence that interprets scenes more accurately than other systems do. Computer vision systems sometimes make inferences about a scene that fly in the face of common sense.

value.title: Self-driving startup Robotics Research raises $228 mln in funding
value.excerpt: Self-driving technology startup Robotic Research said on Thursday it has raised $228 million from investors including SoftBank 9984.T to scale up its commercial division's solutions for trucks, buses and logistics vehicles.
